body_html: Great! Thank you for your clarification. The a.bernoulli_(float_val=0.5) semantic is somewhat misleading as I was expecting bernoulli_ takes itself as the parameter just like bernoulli but just does a in-place replacement instead of create a new tensor. Also the default arg float_val=0.5 is not mentioned in the doc, which makes it worse.

body: Great! Thank you for your clarification. The `a.bernoulli_(float_val=0.5)` semantic is somewhat misleading as I was expecting bernoulli_ takes itself as the parameter just like bernoulli but just does a in-place replacement instead of create a new tensor. Also the default arg `float_val=0.5` is not mentioned in the doc, which makes it worse.
